metadata.title: AI-Enhanced ML-FAANG Mastery Plan
metadata.description: 20-week comprehensive roadmap for ML researchers transitioning to FAANG software engineering roles with AI-powered learning assistance

week.title: Advanced Tree Algorithms + Meta ML Infrastructure
objectives: Master advanced tree algorithms including Segment Trees, Fenwick Trees (BIT), and Tries
Connect advanced tree structures to real-time aggregation and social graph problems at Meta
Build a real-time social graph analyzer project
Deepen understanding of NLP applications of Tries

morning_session.title: Segment Trees & Real-time ML
activities: Segment tree fundamentals with AI-enhanced mathematical foundations
AI explanation connecting segment trees to real-time aggregation in ML pipelines
Range query optimization with AI complexity analysis and implementation strategies

problems.name: Range Sum Query - Mutable
problems.description: AI coaching on segment tree construction
problems.ai_prompt: Explain the process of building the segment tree and the logic for the `update` and `query` functions. How does the tree structure allow for O(log n) performance?

problems.name: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self
problems.ai_prompt: This problem can be solved with a Segment Tree, BIT, or a modified Merge Sort. Explain the Segment Tree approach. What range of values do you need to cover?

evening_session.title: Lazy Propagation & Meta Ranking
activities: Implement AI-optimized segment trees with lazy propagation
ML System Study: Meta's real-time content ranking and engagement prediction
Plan binary indexed trees with AI guidance and optimization

morning_session.title: Binary Indexed Trees & Social Graphs
activities: Binary Indexed Tree (Fenwick Tree) with AI visualization and mathematical proofs
AI explanation connecting BIT to incremental learning and online ML algorithms
Comparison of BIT vs Segment Tree with AI trade-off analysis

problems.name: Range Sum Query - Mutable
problems.ai_prompt: Re-implement this using a Binary Indexed Tree. Explain the `update` and `query` logic based on the bit manipulation of indices. When is a BIT preferred over a Segment Tree?

problems.name: Count of Range Sum
problems.description: Advanced BIT applications with coordinate compression
problems.ai_prompt: Explain how this problem can be transformed and solved using a BIT after calculating prefix sums and performing coordinate compression on these sums.

problems.name: Reverse Pairs
problems.ai_prompt: Compare the classic Merge Sort solution with a solution using a Binary Indexed Tree. What are the conceptual similarities and implementation differences?

evening_session.title: Mock Interview & Friend Recs
activities: AI Mock Interview: Advanced tree problem with real-time constraints
Study social graph algorithms and friend recommendation systems
SQL Practice: Advanced window functions for social media analytics

morning_session.title: Trie Applications & Meta Eng
activities: Advanced Trie applications with AI optimization for memory and performance
AI explanation connecting Tries to tokenization and vocabulary management in NLP
Compressed Tries and radix trees with AI mathematical analysis

problems.name: Stream of Characters
problems.ai_prompt: Explain how to use a Trie to efficiently detect words in a stream of characters. How does the reverse Trie approach optimize the solution?

problems.name: Design Search Autocomplete System
problems.ai_prompt: Design a Trie node to store not just character links but also search frequencies. How would you return the top 3 results at each prefix? Discuss the data structures needed for this.

problems.name: Replace Words
problems.description: Connect to text preprocessing in ML pipelines
problems.ai_prompt: How does using a Trie provide an efficient way to find the shortest root for each word in the sentence? Relate this to tokenization strategies in NLP.

evening_session.title: Prod Trie & Meta NLP
activities: Implement production-level Trie with AI memory optimization techniques
ML Study: Meta's NLP infrastructure and real-time text processing
Plan Meta-specific interview preparation with AI strategic guidance

morning_session.title: Advanced Trees & Meta Prep
activities: Meta's fast execution culture and real-time system requirements
AI analysis of Meta-tagged tree problems and performance optimization
Advanced tree traversal techniques with AI complexity optimization

problems.name: Serialize and Deserialize N-ary Tree
problems.ai_prompt: Design a serialization format for an N-ary tree. Compare a recursive preorder approach with a level-order (BFS) approach. Discuss handling of null children.

problems.name: Vertical Order Traversal of a Binary Tree
problems.ai_prompt: This requires sorting by column, then row, then value. Explain how to use a BFS or DFS approach while storing nodes with their coordinates, and then perform a final sort.

evening_session.title: Meta Mock & PyTorch Study
activities: AI Mock Interview: Meta format (speed + real-time optimization focus)
Study Meta's ML infrastructure including PyTorch distributed training
Plan advanced optimization with AI strategic guidance

morning_session.title: Tree Optimization & Contest
activities: Advanced tree optimization techniques with AI performance analysis
AI explanation of tree algorithms in production ML system architectures
Contest-level tree problem strategies with AI tactical guidance

problems.name: Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum
problems.description: Advanced tree DP with AI optimization
problems.ai_prompt: Explain the recursive helper function. What two values does it need to compute at each node to solve the problem? (i.e., max path through the node vs. max path from the node upwards)

problems.name: Recover Binary Search Tree
problems.ai_prompt: The key insight is that an inorder traversal of a corrupted BST will have one or two 'dips'. Explain how to find the two swapped nodes using an inorder traversal. Discuss the O(1) space (Morris traversal) solution.

problems.name: House Robber III
problems.ai_prompt: Define the DP state for a node. Why is it optimal to return a pair of values from the recursive calls: one for robbing the current house, and one for not robbing it?

evening_session.title: Hacker Cup & Analysis
activities: Meta Hacker Cup practice with AI real-time coaching
AI analysis of contest performance and advanced tree algorithm mastery
Weekend project planning with Meta ML system integration

saturday.title: Portfolio Project: Real-Time Analytics Engine with Segment Trees
saturday.description: Build a high-performance real-time analytics engine using segment trees and advanced tree algorithms for efficient range queries and updates. The system will handle streaming data aggregations for ML feature engineering and real-time monitoring.

problems.name: Range Sum Query 2D - Mutable
problems.description: 2D segment tree for matrix range operations

problems.name: Binary Tree Cameras
problems.description: Greedy algorithm on trees for minimum coverage

tasks: Implement segment trees with lazy propagation for efficient range updates and queries.
Create a streaming data aggregation system using binary indexed trees for real-time metrics.
Build advanced tree traversal algorithms for hierarchical data analysis and feature extraction.
Design a distributed tree structure for handling petabyte-scale analytics workloads.
saturday.deliverable: A scalable analytics engine with real-time dashboard, streaming data ingestion, and comprehensive performance benchmarks.

sunday.title: ML System Study: Meta's Real-Time Content Ranking Infrastructure
sunday.description: Analyze Meta's News Feed and Instagram ranking systems, focusing on how tree-based algorithms enable real-time content scoring, user preference modeling, and personalized feed generation at billions of users scale.

problems.name: Sum Root to Leaf Numbers
problems.description: Tree path aggregation for scoring calculations

tasks: Study how Meta uses tree structures for organizing user interests and content categories.
Analyze real-time scoring algorithms and how tree traversals compute personalized rankings.
Research hierarchical user modeling and how trees represent user preference embeddings.
Implement a mini content ranking system using tree-based algorithms from your analytics engine.
sunday.deliverable: Technical analysis of Meta's ranking systems with working prototype of tree-based content recommendation engine.
